Property ownership/lease proof Building plans and rate/menu lists Owner/manager character certificate Staff CNICs and medical certificates Business incorporation documents (if applicable)
Fines, immediate closure, and legal action under GB Hotel & Restaurant Act 2019 or Tour Operators Act 2020.
Hotels: Room standards, public facilities, safety equipment and Restaurants: Kitchen hygiene, seating capacity, food storage areas

Submit FORM‑I along with: an attested CNIC copy, domicile (if applicable), academic certificates, two recent passport‑size photos, an original Police Character Certificate, a medical‑fitness certificate, proof of training/experience, a recommendation letter from a registered tour operator, the treasury‑challan fee receipt, and a signed affidavit
Submit online application with route map, team passports, insurance, licensed guide details, and pay fees. Apply 30 days before expedition.
Contact DTS directly, request to see current license certificate, or check official records.
Block A, 1st Floor, Gilgit-Baltistan Secretariat Building Jutial, Gilgit

sources.title: Services | Directorate Tourist Services Gilgit Baltistan

paragraphs: Comprehensive tourism services to support visitors and businesses in Gilgit Baltistan

The Directorate of Tourist Services provides a wide range of services to support tourism in Gilgit Baltistan. From regulatory functions to promotional activities, we are committed to ensuring a high-quality experience for visitors and sustainable growth for the tourism industry.
Access all tourism-related laws and regulations
Apply for and renew tourism business licenses
Hotel and restaurant quality grading system
Find approved tourism service providers
Information about service fees and payments
Download forms and important documents

The Directorate of Tourist Services issues and renews licenses for various tourism businesses operating in Gilgit Baltistan. Our licensing process ensures that all tourism service providers meet the required standards for quality and safety.
For businesses organizing and selling tour packages in Gilgit Baltistan.
For accommodation providers including hotels, motels, and guesthouses.
For food service establishments catering to tourists.
For individuals providing guiding services to tourists.
For businesses offering adventure activities like trekking, climbing, and rafting.
Complete and submit the application form along with required documents and fees.
Our team verifies all submitted documents and information for completeness and accuracy.
For physical establishments, an inspection is conducted to ensure compliance with standards.
Applications meeting all requirements are approved, and licenses are issued.
Successful applicants receive their license, valid for the specified period.
The typical processing time for license applications is 15-30 working days, depending on the type of license and completeness of documentation.

Our quality grading system helps tourists identify establishments that meet specific standards of service, cleanliness, and facilities. The grading system applies to hotels, restaurants, and other tourism facilities.
Hotels are graded on a 1–5 star scale based on the following criteria:
Access important forms, applications, guidelines, and other documents related to tourism services in Gilgit Baltistan.
Block A, 1st Floor, Gilgit-Baltistan Secretariat Building Jutial, Gilgit
[email protected]
Mon–Fri: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM
© 2024 Directorate of Tourist Services, Gilgit Baltistan. All Rights Reserved.

paragraphs: Complete guide to obtaining and renewing tourism business licenses in Gilgit-Baltistan

The Directorate of Tourist Services is responsible for regulating tourism businesses in Gilgit-Baltistan through a comprehensive licensing system. All tourism-related businesses must obtain proper licenses to operate legally in the region.

sources.title: Pakistan Visa Types - Comprehensive Visa Information

headings: How to Apply for Mountaineering Visa?
paragraphs: Comprehensive information about different visa types available for visiting Pakistan, including tourism, mountaineering, and trekking visas.
Pakistan is home to some of the world's highest peaks including K2, Nanga Parbat, and Gasherbrum. Our mountaineering visa facilitates climbing expeditions to approved peaks.
For climbing mountains included in the approved mountaineering list.
List of Mountains for which Visa can be applied includes K2, Nanga Parbat, Broad Peak, Gasherbrum I & II, and other approved peaks.
Up to 3 Months – Single Entry Visa
4 Weeks (Working Days)
Visa Application Fee + Peak Royalty Fee (payable upon arrival in Pakistan)
Official Pakistan Visa Documentation
Applicant must be a national of 192 Countries eligible for online visa under Pakistan Online Visa System and have mountaineering experience.
In your application, under Purpose of Visit – Mention the specific mountain from the approved list which you intend to climb
Your Sponsor letter/Agreement must be with a tour operator authorized by the DTS for mountaineering expeditions
Peak royalty fees vary depending on the mountain and season
If application is Sent Back for Review, processing time will restart from re-submission date
Application will be cancelled if not resubmitted within 7 days of review request
Plan your expedition only after acquiring Visa Grant Notice and peak permits
Mountaineering season restrictions apply (typically May-September)
Start your visa application process today
Follow our comprehensive step-by-step guide to ensure a smooth and successful visa application process. Track your progress with our interactive checklist.
Complete all requirements to track your application progress
Find a DTS-authorized mountaineering tour operator
Gather all necessary mountaineering documentation
Apply through Pakistan Online Visa System
Wait for visa processing and prepare for expedition
Find a DTS-authorized mountaineering tour operator
Gather all necessary mountaineering documentation
Apply through Pakistan Online Visa System
Wait for visa processing and prepare for expedition
The entire visa application process typically takes 4-6 weeks from start to finish. Use our interactive checklist to track your progress and ensure you don't miss any requirements.
25 requirements remaining
4 weeks (working days)
25 items to complete
Apply through visa.nadra.gov.pk
Get help with your application
Application forms and documents
Discover Pakistans attractions

paragraphs: Discover the breathtaking destinations of Pakistan's northern paradise

Hunza Valley is a mountainous valley in the Gilgit-Baltistan region of Pakistan. The valley is situated at an elevation of 2,438 meters and is surrounded by several high mountain peaks, including Rakaposhi, Ultar Sar, and Ladyfinger Peak.

Known for its breathtaking landscapes, ancient culture, and friendly locals, Hunza Valley is often referred to as "heaven on earth." The valley is home to ancient forts, terraced fields, and traditional villages that offer a glimpse into the rich cultural heritage of the region.
May to October
2,438 meters
Landscapes, Culture, Longevity
Gilgit Airport (100 km)
Make the most of your visit to Gilgit Baltistan with these helpful travel tips.travel tips.

The best time to visit Gilgit Baltistan is from May to October when the weather is pleasant and most roads are open. July and August can be busy, so consider visiting in May, June, September, or October for fewer crowds.

Public transport is available but can be limited. Consider hiring a local driver or joining a tour for convenience. The Karakoram Highway connects most major destinations, but some remote areas require 4x4 vehicles or hiking.

Many destinations in Gilgit Baltistan are at high altitudes. Allow time to acclimatize, stay hydrated, and be aware of altitude sickness symptoms. Consider a gradual ascent if planning to visit high-altitude areas.

HomeAboutServicesRegulationsFeesContactLoginRegisterHomeAboutServicesRegulationsFeesContactLoginRegisterExplore Gilgit BaltistanDiscover the breathtaking destinations of Pakistan's northern paradiseHome>DestinationsHunza ValleyHunza Valley is a mountainous valley in the Gilgit-Baltistan region of Pakistan. The valley is situated at an elevation of 2,438 meters and is surrounded by several high mountain peaks, including Rakaposhi, Ultar Sar, and Ladyfinger Peak.Known for its breathtaking landscapes, ancient culture, and friendly locals, Hunza Valley is often referred to as "heaven on earth." The valley is home to ancient forts, terraced fields, and traditional villages that offer a glimpse into the rich cultural heritage of the region.Best Time to VisitMay to OctoberAltitude2,438 metersFamous ForLandscapes, Culture, LongevityNearest AirportGilgit Airport (100 km)Travel TipsMake the most of your visit to Gilgit Baltistan with these helpful travel tips.travel tips.Best Time to VisitThe best time to visit Gilgit Baltistan is from May to October when the weather is pleasant and most roads are open. July and August can be busy, so consider visiting in May, June, September, or October for fewer crowds.

Getting AroundPublic transport is available but can be limited. Consider hiring a local driver or joining a tour for convenience. The Karakoram Highway connects most major destinations, but some remote areas require 4x4 vehicles or hiking.

Altitude AwarenessMany destinations in Gilgit Baltistan are at high altitudes. Allow time to acclimatize, stay hydrated, and be aware of altitude sickness symptoms. Consider a gradual ascent if planning to visit high-altitude areas.

paragraphs: Guidelines and regulations for tourism activities in Gilgit Baltistan

The Directorate of Tourist Services has established regulations to ensure the safety of tourists, protect the natural environment, and maintain the quality of tourism services in Gilgit Baltistan. These regulations apply to tourists, tour operators, accommodation providers, and other tourism stakeholders.
Tourists visiting Gilgit Baltistan are required to follow these regulations to ensure a safe and enjoyable experience while respecting the local culture and environment.
Certain activities and areas in Gilgit Baltistan require special permits. Make sure you have the necessary permits before planning your activities.
Required for trekking in certain areas, especially those close to international borders or in protected natural reserves.
Apply through the Department of Tourist Services or through a licensed tour operator. Processing time is typically 3-5 working days.
Required for climbing peaks in Gilgit Baltistan. Different peaks have different permit requirements and fees.
Apply through the Alpine Club of Pakistan or through a licensed expedition organizer. Processing time is typically 2-4 weeks.
Required for visiting areas close to international borders or areas with special security considerations.
Apply through the Ministry of Interior or through a licensed tour operator. Processing time varies and can take up to 4 weeks.

faq.question: What is DTS?
faq.answer: DTS (Directorate of Tourism Services) is the official government department for tourism in Gilgit-Baltistan, Pakistan. It manages tourism services, licensing, permits, and promotes the region's natural beauty.

faq.question: How do I apply for tourism licenses in Gilgit-Baltistan?
faq.answer: You can apply for various tourism licenses including Tour Operator License, Hotel/Camping License, and Tour Guide License through the DTS online portal at https://app.dtsgb.gog.pk/app after creating an account.

faq.question: What are the fees for expeditions and tourism services?
faq.answer: DTS has different fee structures for general tourism services and expedition fees. Detailed fee information is available on the official website under the Fees & Expeditions section.

faq.question: How can I get a tourist visa for Gilgit-Baltistan?
faq.answer: Tourist visa information, eligibility criteria, required documents, and application process are available on the DTS website. You can apply online and check all requirements before visiting.

faq.question: What mountaineering opportunities are available in Gilgit-Baltistan?
faq.answer: Gilgit-Baltistan offers world-class mountaineering opportunities including K2, Nanga Parbat, and many other peaks. DTS provides information on historical summits, upcoming expeditions, and successful climbers.

faq.question: Where can I find the latest news and advisories for tourism in Gilgit-Baltistan?
faq.answer: The latest tourism news, advisories, and safety updates are regularly published on the DTS website's News & Advisories section. This includes important travel information and expedition updates.

faq.question: What adventure activities are available in Gilgit-Baltistan?
faq.answer: The region offers various mountain adventures including trekking, mountaineering, rock climbing, river rafting, and cultural tours. Information about these activities is available through DTS services.

faq.question: How can I contact DTS for support?
faq.answer: You can contact DTS through multiple channels: Phone: +92-5811-920001, Email: info@dtsgb.gog.pk, Helpline: 1422, or visit their office at Directorate of Tourism Services, Gilgit-Baltistan.

faq.question: What are the popular destinations in Gilgit-Baltistan?
faq.answer: Popular destinations include Skardu (gateway to K2), Hunza Valley, Fairy Meadows (Nanga Parbat base camp), Deosai National Park, Khunjerab Pass, and many other stunning locations with rich cultural heritage.

faq.question: What regulations should tourists be aware of?
faq.answer: Tourists should be aware of local regulations regarding permits, protected areas, cultural sensitivities, and safety guidelines. Complete regulation information is available through DTS official channels.
